title: Chief Complaint
content: bilateral hand numbness and tingling as well as burning pain

title: HPI Spencer
content: The patient presents with bilateral hand numbness, tingling, and burning pain that began on July 1, 2025. These symptoms are similar to those experienced at the end of her previous pregnancy but are occurring earlier and are more intense. She has been seeing her OB, who recommended injections and referred her to this office. She has been wearing splints but has not experienced sufficient improvement to sleep through the night.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Bilateral upper extremity skin is clean, dry, and intact without erythema or ecchymosis. Decreased sensation to the middle fingers is noted.

title: Assessment
content: decreased sensation to the middle fingers

title: Plan
content: discuss risks and temporary nature of injections
follow up in three months postpartum if symptoms persist
